availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James R. Page (Asst. KY Sec. State)

body.p: Frankfort, Kentucky, merchant, soldier, and assistant secretary of state. New York native. Married to Mary J. Page. Father of Isaac R. Page, Henry C. page, John H. Page, and James R. Page. Merchant in Frankfort in 1860. Captain and major in the 9th Kentucky Cavalry from August 1862 to September 1863. Assistant secretary of state under Ephraim Van Winkle and John Van Winkle.

ab.bibl: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 80; “Decoration Day,” The Frankfort Roundabout (Frankfort, Ky.), May 28, 1892, p. 3; "Memorandum," The Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky.), May 31, 1867, p. 1; Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0098.
